Name: Stela of Hait (?)
Description: A small rectangular stela with a rounded top. The decorated sections are demarcated by simple incised lines, the lower lines almost reaching the sides of the stela. The individual registers are separated by similar simple lines, which at the same time function as register lines for the scenes, which are carved without inner detail.The texts are also incised and without inner detail. they have been rather hastily executed. Between lines 1 and 3 is a vertical separator in black ink, but otherwise there are no separators between the lines. There are traces of paint.
